title: Georgia Boy Williams
text:
Bascom Delois Williams (October 23, 1908 – November 9, 1990), known as Georgia Boy Williams, was a Florida state legislator. He served in the <a href="Florida%20House%20of%20Representatives">Florida House of Representatives</a> from 1956 to 1959 for <a href="Columbia%20County%2C%20Florida">Columbia County, Florida</a>. He lived in <a href="Lake%20City%2C%20Florida">Lake City, Florida</a>.
Williams was born in 1908 at <a href="Bonifay%2C%20Florida">Bonifay, Florida</a> and was educated at public schools. He married Ocille A. Jenkins of <a href="Chipley%2C%20Florida">Chipley, Florida</a> and had four children, Phyllis Amanda, Sylvia Del, Billie Joe and Freddie June. His occupation was a <a href="Greyhound%20bus">Greyhound bus</a> driver. Williams' religion was listed as <a href="Methodist">Methodist</a> and recreational interests as <a href="fishing">fishing</a> and <a href="American%20football">football</a>.
